title: All 'Top Sites' bookmarks gone.  Again.  AGAIN.
content:
What is the major malfunction here? Why is it every major update you have to delete ALL of my 'Top Sites' and add your own? I just want to open the page and use the bookmarks that I want to use. I don't want Google, I don't want Imgur, I don't want what sites YOU want to put on my top sites which are sites I don't even visit. I found 'Recommended by Pocket', 'Highlights', and 'Snippets' turned back on and I'm getting sick of it. Stop forcing YOUR options on us and let US choose what WE want Firefox to do.

And like in my last thread the last time this happened, is it WAY too much to ask that you reintroduce the 'drag and drop' feature to add bookmarks to the 'Top Sites' list? This thing of having to press two separate buttons and then actually TYPE everything in is counter intuitive and inefficient.

Seriously starting to think I should switch to Chrome... or maybe IE.

title: FF 67 Tab button Inefficient
content:
In the new version of FF (67.0), the "refresh" button in the toolbar now gets attention if I click the Tab key from the address bar.

In other words, previously if I opened a new tab (ctrl+t) and pressed the Tab button on my keyboard, it would switch directly from the Address Bar to the Search Box and I could type in what I want to search for. Now, if I open a new tab and press the Tab button, the attention switches to the Refresh button next to the Address Bar, so I have to press Tab twice to get to the Search Box.

I tried removing the Refresh button entirely (ctrl+r works just as well), but then FF just forces attention to go to Zoom or the "..." buttons next to the Address Bar - it still is making me press Tab twice to get to the Search Box.

title: Firefox 67 pasa por alto mi configuracion de "font-size" para impresion
content:
Hola buen día

Verán, tengo una pagina desarrollada en php que hace un reporte, dicho reporte requiere ser impreso, pero para esto, tengo diferentes tipos de tamaño de letra en dicho reporte (5pt, 9pt, 7pt, 14pt y 15pt), ya leí la siguiente documentación https://developer.mozilla.org/es/docs/Web/CSS/font-size, creí que el problema era como estaba declarando la propiedad de font-size : 

                         *font-size:14px;

Ya ocupe lo que viene descrito en la liga que deje anteriormente: 

                          *font-size: xx-large;

pero al imprimir toda la letra se me imprime de un mismo tamaño en grande, descuadrando toda la impresión. Ya leí también las actualizaciones que trae la versión 57 -> https://developer.mozilla.org/es/docs/Mozilla/Firefox/Releases/57, donde indican que "Gecko además maneja la herencia de font-size de manera diferente a la de Quantum ", agradezco me comenten si hay alguna opción en Firefox para deshabilitar esto o como podría arreglarlo.

Gracias. Saludos.

title: FF Quantum 67.0 does not load smoothly; using taskbar icon allows page to load/switch
content:
The question is vague, but I don't know how to describe it better. Since updating to 67.0 Quantum, and until last night, when I started FF, the toolbars showed up, but the main page was blank. If I clicked on the home icon, my start page (news.google.com) loaded fine, and away I went.

Yesterday, in an attempt to fix the above, I uninstalled and reinstalled FF. Since I did that, the following happens: 

- Starting FF shows a completely blank page. 
- Pressing the FF icon on the taskbar so that FF minimizes and then expands shows the toolbar.
- Pressing the FF icon on the taskbar again as above loads my home page.
- At this point, I can access the settings menu, but clicking anywhere else on the page does nothing, until
- I press the FF icon on the taskbar to minimize and expand switches to whatever I've clicked on.


The same thing happens typing URLs in to the address bar. If I drag to highlight, I have to minimize/expand FF to show the highlighting; when I type in a new address, I have to minimize/expand FF to go to the new address - and I have to go through the same minimize/expand dance with the taskbar icon.

It's like I'm having to load individual frames of a movie, rather than the movie running smoothly.

And, to make it even more fun, when I start with add-ons disabled, FF works fine.

I have uninstalled, downloaded and reinstalled multiple times, including as administrator; I have refreshed multiple times with no success. I have disabled the few addons and extensions that are installed in my FF and restarted, with no success. I also updated my IS suite (Norton) and removed and re-added FF to my trusted list.


I am not having this issue with other browsers.

Thanks in advance for your assistance.

title: Problema Firefox con OpenStreetmap
content:
He creado un mapa con OpenStreetMap y la libreria Leaflet, con petición ajax a un .geojson externo.

Al comprobar la compatibilidad en un servidor local con los navegadores, Chrome, Opera, Edge funciona todo OK. Pero Firefox da los siguientes problemas:

Algunas veces no carga el mapa. Otras carga el mapa a trozos. La carga del .geojson la hace correctamente y los muestra en el mapa, pero el mapa casi nunca se ve.

Desde Firefox accedo a https://tile.openstreetmap.org/cgi-bin/debug y obtengo The connection has timed out

Tambien intento abrir https://www.openstreetmap.org/#map=6/40.007/-2.488 y obtengo lo mismo The connection has timed out

Mí versión de Firefox es => 66.0.5 (64-bit) corriendo bajo Manjaro(Linux)

¿Cuál es el problema de Firefox con OpenStreeMap?

title: How to recover data from *memory* cache (not disk)?
content:
My 11 year old typed in a big blog entry on Wix for a school thing and then accidentally deleted it. He's one of those kids that really has to work to write much, so he's *really* discouraged and it's worth some effort on my part to recover. Wix has no recovery tools I can find, and there is nothing in the disk cache. However when I fired up about:cache I did find several potentially interesting files in the "memory" section. When clicking on them, I get a page with the title "Cache entry information", a bunch of header info etc, and then a big chunk of what looks like hex data with checksums or something e.g:

00000000: 1f 8b 08 00 00 00 00 00 00 03 ec bd db 92 1b 57 ...............W 00000010: 96 a6 f9 2a 50 5c 8c b2 7a 18 91 7e 84 bb 73 6c ...*P\..z..~..sl 00000020: ac 8c a2 a4 4c 96 e9 34 22 2b d3 ba 2b db 68 7e ....L..4"+..+.h~ etc...

To complicate matters further the machine he was on is an old unstable one, so to capture the data before it died again (and presumably wiped the memory cache), I went through the cache and saved all of the likely looking files.

Some of them are pretty big, so I am optimistic there is something in there at least, but I can't figure out how to access them. Naively it seems like there should be some way to get FF to interpret them as arriving from a server, rather than just displaying the data as text the way it does if I load the file. I've also tried editing out the decorative HTML from the cache file I saved and making a file that looks like a server response, using only the headers & pre-formatted text from the cache file, but no luck. Any advice?

thanks

title: Firefox Awesome bar suggestions don't work, bookmarks won't add or delete (Fixed)
content:
I encountered peculiar behaviour in Firefox (Macbook Pro / High Sierra). The Firefox Awesome bar (address/search bar) stopped showing suggestions. It did show some suggestions but only after typing 'http://'. After weeks of torment I discovered that the problem wasn't limited to the awesome bar itself – the history and bookmarks stopped working properly as well. History ceased displaying recently visited sites (only the ones I visited weeks ago) while I also could not add or delete bookmarks ('Bookmark this page' and 'Delete bookmark' functions didn't do a thing).

I tried many fixes, starting off by googling for solutions. I tried clearing cache, disabling search suggestions and enabling them again under Preferences, reinstalling Firefox, resetting PRAM, updating my OS. None of the above fixes worked.

I fixed all the problems by following this guide on repairing faulty bookmarks: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/cant-add-change-or-save-bookmarks Removing the xulstore.json and places.sqlite files and restarting Firefox did the job, everything is working smoothly again. I'm sharing this in case there are others like me, who are searching for a fix to the awesome bar only and not to the bookmarks or history.
